settings.text:
Visits are arranged to meet you where you’re at and from the comfort of your home. I want to hear about how you’re adjusting to life with a baby, even if it’s tough stuff: your feelings, emotions and thoughts-good or bad. I will answer any questions you may have, visit with you, and provide resources and tips on infant feeding. I will also help you plan meals and give you a grocery list to make life a little easier. If possible, we can arrange contact-free drop off of what you need—support through community, a meal train, or good friends and family is vital in building your village.

I aim to provide support past the initial weeks with a newborn. Postpartum care is widely underrated and can be so helpful to new parents, those with toddlers or multiple children through simple acts of caring for the parent, while you care for your family.

settings.heading: In-Home Visits
settings.row_content: • Within the first two weeks postpartum, your doula will schedule visits to your home, providing emotional support, practical assistance, and answering any questions you may have about the birth experience or newborn care.

settings.heading: Emotional Support
settings.row_content: Your doula is here to listen and provide a safe space for you to share your feelings, emotions, and thoughts about adjusting to life with a new baby. We've been right where you're sitting and hear you on the good, the bad, and the tough stuff.

settings.heading: Resources and Tips on Infant Feeding
settings.row_content: Your doula will provide valuable tips on managing milk supply and infant feeding, including breastfeeding, bottle-feeding and using supplementary systems, to help you navigate this important aspect of newborn care.

settings.heading: Meal Planning & Grocery Lists
settings.row_content: Your doula will help you plan meals and provide a grocery list to make your life a little easier during the postpartum period. We can also arrange contact-free drop-off of needed items, organize a meal train, or designate assistance from your community of friends and family.

settings.heading: Ongoing Postpartum Care
settings.row_content: Your doula understands that postpartum care extends beyond the initial weeks with a newborn. We are committed to providing ongoing support to new parents, those with toddlers, or multiple children through simple acts of caring for the parent, while you care for your family.

settings.heading: Sleep Support
settings.row_content: Educate about newborn sleep patterns and safe sleep practices, provide guidance on techniques to soothe a fussy baby, and offer suggestions for parents to maximize their own rest.

settings.heading: Newborn Care Education
settings.row_content: Teach or review basic newborn care skills such as bathing, diapering, swaddling, understanding baby's cues, and so on.

settings.heading: Breastfeeding & Bottle Feeding Support
settings.row_content: Assist with any breastfeeding or bottle feeding issues that arise, and provide referrals to lactation consultants if needed.

settings.heading: Physical Recovery Support
settings.row_content: Provide information and support for the physical recovery process after birth, such as care for perineal areas, recognizing signs of infection, and understanding what's normal during postpartum healing.

settings.heading: Postpartum Exercise Guidance
settings.row_content: Once approved by a healthcare provider, provide advice or resources on safe postpartum exercises to strengthen the body and boost mood.

settings.heading: Mental Health Check-Ins
settings.row_content: Regularly check in on the mother's mental health, provide resources and referrals if signs of postpartum depression or anxiety are evident.

settings.heading: Baby Equipment Advice
settings.row_content: Provide advice on the usage of baby equipment such as carriers, strollers, or breast pumps.

settings.heading: Parenting Resources
settings.row_content: Provide resources and tips on general parenting topics as needed, such as infant development or child safety.
